intro: Actinotinus, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of a single species, Actinotinus campanulatus, which is native to the southern United States. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, waxy leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. The plant has a long flowering period, typically from late spring to early summer.
